T1.label: Iron Ore Cash Generation
T1.description: Iron Ore Cash Generation — Pilbara Delivers
T1.plain_english: Rio's Pilbara iron ore system is the world's lowest-cost major operation, generating exceptional cash flow at current prices.
T1.what_to_watch: Iron ore prices, Pilbara shipment volumes, C1 cost trajectory.
T1.upside: Material re-rating if iron ore prices sustain above US$100/t and copper ramp accelerates.
T1.risk_plain: If iron ore breaks below US$90/t, earnings compress significantly.

T2.label: Energy Transition Portfolio
T2.description: Energy Transition Portfolio — Copper and Lithium Optionality
T2.plain_english: Rio is building significant positions in copper (Oyu Tolgoi) and lithium (Arcadium) for the energy transition.
T2.what_to_watch: Oyu Tolgoi ramp-up progress, copper prices, Arcadium integration, lithium price recovery.
T2.upside: If copper and lithium contribute 30-40% of EBITDA by 2030, significant re-rating potential.
T2.risk_plain: If growth projects face cost overruns or commodity prices remain depressed, capital is destroyed.

T3.label: China Demand Slowdown
T3.description: China Demand Slowdown — Property Sector Drag
T3.plain_english: China's property sector downturn reduces steel and iron ore demand structurally.
T3.what_to_watch: China steel production, property sector starts, iron ore port inventories.
T3.risk_plain: If China steel production declines below 950Mtpa, iron ore prices could break below US$80/t.

T4.label: Growth Capex Risk
T4.description: Growth Capex Risk — Simandou and Arcadium Execution
T4.plain_english: Over US$15B in growth capital committed to Simandou, Arcadium, and Oyu Tolgoi carries execution risk.
T4.what_to_watch: Simandou first ore timing, Arcadium impairment testing, total capex vs free cash flow.
T4.risk_plain: If project execution falters, capital deployed destroys value and shareholder returns are reduced.

big_picture: Rio Tinto Limited (ASX: RIO) — coverage initiated. Full analysis pending.
